comment: It needs a way to sort and delete offline. Other than that it's nice to have.

title: Good reader, but missing a key feature
comment: This succeeds as a way to read your wallabag articles. However, more valuable to me would be a quick way to add articles via the share menu. Instead, a browser opens and you have to log in.

title: Http auth
comment: Can you add ability to log into a site behind  http basic authentication (I.e httpasswd/apache)

title: Just a start
comment: Almost better to use the website, very limited features. Would like to be able to change font settings!

title: Opens Firefox
comment: Sharing article from RSS reader starts Firefox, instead of using app. As well as that, it crashes fairly often. Nexus 5 with Lollipop.

title: Good start
comment: Works well, but only as a quick way to add to your server and as the *most* basic reader. I.e. can't delete articles, etc. Would love to see this evolve into a very Pocket-like feature set with article management, ability to cache favourites for offline reading, download/save to phone (as PDF say) etc. One day!
Encoding :(((
The encoding problem is now fixed! No need to update the application.

title: Very cool app
comment: Update: Images there now, if I could only import my pocket data to the hosted account....... :) Just because I have so many articles in Pocket, I'd love to get them into Poche.  Thanks for a great app!

Hello David, 

Thank you so much for your comment :) 
We released new version, can you try it please?

title: Unable to read webpages
comment: Downloaded the wallabag app and then spent 15 mins creating an account on frama bag to get the settings working and for it to sync. Now when I "bag" any web pages they do not appear in the app at all and on frama bag it just says Untitled with no content showing. V v confusing application that I can't work out.

Hello Claire, 

Can you open a new issue here please https://github.com/wallabag/wallabag/issues/new 
It will be easier to help you :)

title: Limited functionality?
comment: (apologies for the repost, I accidentally deleted my previous comment before I read the dev's reply...)  I don't get it - how exactly does it work?  Every time I share something and send it to Wallabag it opens a web page on my server's Wallabag installation... Could it be it's not logging in or something?

Hello Themistocles Papassilekas!
When you are on login screen, you have a checkbox to stay connected. Did you checked it?
I just set wallabag up and I love it so far.
Thank you so much Stefan. Don't hesitate to tell us what you want on wallabag!

title: Works OK unless you are using http basic auth.
comment: You can't user this of you want to use basic auth.

Hello Salvatore!

We released a new version, don't hesitate to try it ;-)

title: Still no images
comment: Last night I updated my server instance to the latest build 1.71 but I still don't get any images in my articles. Get this working and add some share options and this would be a fantastic app.

Hello Mike,

Can you try our latest version please? Pictures are now displayed :)
Would be nice if you could add links from within the app, no errors or issues on my devices, overall pretty nice
Thank you for your comment!

title: Doesn't work at all
comment: It doesn't display any saved articles at all nor does it give any indication why it's not connecting or syncing. And what's up with the naming? Is this "In the poche" or Wallabag?

Hello Chris,
Do you host your own wallabag or do you use Framabag.org? 
We just released new version with "wallabag" name ;-)

title: Limited App
comment: Galaxy S4 Android ver. 4.3 Browsers: Chrome, Firefox, Internet, Next browser & Javelin  App redirects to the Wallabag website without returning you to the article.   Does not automatically Sync with App so you must sync before being able to see an updated list.  Many saves titled: "Untitled" [unable to retrieve full-text content]...  Branding inconsistent:  App "In the poche" Product known as Wallabag?  Compared to Pocket this app is slow and clumsy but does have good possibilities!

Hello Greg,

We just released new version with the good name :)
Images not showing
I think this problem is due to the web app, not the android app. The next version of poche will fix this problem.

title: Works well
comment: This app works well for what it is. I do hope to see one thing in future versions, though: Presently, the app doesn't/cant sync a local copy of the poche content so you can read it when there's no internet connection. Is this possible in the future?

Hi Chris! 

Thank you for your comment. 
The offline reading will be available with poche v2 (release when it will be finished). 

Have a nice day!

title: Works perfectly fine
comment: This app allows you to save new links by "Sharing" them to In The Poche from a browser. It works perfectly fine. I'd prefer if the login process was transparent (ie. login in the application, and not on the website to which the app redirects), but I have no idea if it's an acceptable change for this app...

I would add this feature when poche will have an API. (maybe the next major release)
I would like to keep all the process (login and validation) transparent.
